statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem graphically}\\ \text{Maximise} Z=3x+2y \\ \text{subject to the constraints} \\ x+2y \le 10,\, 3x + y \le 15,\, x, y \ge 0

step.context: \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?}
step.reason: \text{Given the constraints}\\ \text{the area would be restricted to}\\ \text{the X and Y axes, and } x+2y\le 1 \\ \text{ for }x \in [0, 4] \text{ and } 3x+y\le 15 \text{ for } x\in [4, 5]

step.context: \text{What is the value of the Maximum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?}
step.reason: \text{Maximum is calculated by substituting}\\ \text{the correct corner points into the }\\ \text{objective function } Z=3x+2y
